original_definition: 'Rated voltage of a winding' is the voltage assigned to be applied, or developed at no-load, between the terminals of an untapped winding, or of a tapped winding connected on the principal tapping.
generated_definition: 'Rated voltage of a winding' means the rated voltage of a winding is the maximum voltage that a winding is designed to withstand in normal operation without causing damage to the winding or the equipment it is connected to.

Article 2: ‘Rated voltage of a winding’ (Ur) is the voltage assigned to be applied, or developed at no-load, between the terminals of an untapped winding, or of a tapped winding connected on the principal tapping.
